pageProps.contentHtml:
Hadamard factorization

Show that

sin⁡z−zcos⁡z=z33∏n=1∞(1−z2λn2),z∈C,\sin{z} - z\cos{z} = \frac{z^3}{3} \prod_{n=1}^\infty \p{1 - \frac{z^2}{\lambda_n^2}}, \quad z \in \C,sinz−zcosz=3z3​n=1∏∞​(1−λn2​z2​),z∈C,

where {λn}n\set{\lambda_n}_n{λn​}n​ is a sequence in C\CC, λn≠0\lambda_n \neq 0λn​=0 for all nnn, such that

∑n=1∞1∣λn∣2<∞.\sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{\abs{\lambda_n}^2} < \infty.n=1∑∞​∣λn​∣21​<∞.
Solution.

Let f(z)=sin⁡z−zcos⁡zf\p{z} = \sin{z} - z\cos{z}f(z)=sinz−zcosz. Notice that f(−z)=−sin⁡z+zcos⁡z=−f(z)f\p{-z} = -\sin{z} + z\cos{z} = -f\p{z}f(−z)=−sinz+zcosz=−f(z). Thus, if λ\lambdaλ is a root of fff, then so is −λ-\lambda−λ. Let {−λn,λn}n\set{-\lambda_n, \lambda_n}_n{−λn​,λn​}n​ be the non-zero zeroes of fff counted with multiplicity. At the origin, we have

f(0)=0f′(z)=zsin⁡z  ⟹  f′(0)=0f′′(z)=sin⁡z+zcos⁡z  ⟹  f′′(0)=0f′′′(z)=2cos⁡z−zsin⁡z  ⟹  f′′′(0)=2,\begin{aligned} f\p{0} &= 0 \\ f'\p{z} = z\sin{z} \implies f'\p{0} &= 0 \\ f''\p{z} = \sin{z} + z\cos{z} \implies f''\p{0} &= 0 \\ f'''\p{z} = 2\cos{z} - z\sin{z} \implies f'''\p{0} &= 2, \end{aligned}f(0)f′(z)=zsinz⟹f′(0)f′′(z)=sinz+zcosz⟹f′′(0)f′′′(z)=2cosz−zsinz⟹f′′′(0)​=0=0=0=2,​

so fff has a zero of order 333 at the origin. fff is also entire of first order since z,sin⁡z,cos⁡zz, \sin{z}, \cos{z}z,sinz,cosz all are, so by Hadamard factorization,

f(z)=eaz+bz3∏n=1∞(1−z2λn2)f\p{z} = e^{az+b} z^3 \prod_{n=1}^\infty \p{1 - \frac{z^2}{\lambda_n^2}}f(z)=eaz+bz3n=1∏∞​(1−λn2​z2​)

with

∑n=1∞1∣λn∣2<∞.\sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{\abs{\lambda_n}^2} < \infty.n=1∑∞​∣λn​∣21​<∞.

To complete the proof, we need to calculate a,b∈Ca, b \in \Ca,b∈C. Notice that if a3a_3a3​ is the coefficient of z3z^3z3 in the Taylor series of fff, then

eb=lim⁡z→0f(z)z3=a3=f′′′(0)3!=13.e^b = \lim_{z\to0} \frac{f\p{z}}{z^3} = a_3 = \frac{f'''\p{0}}{3!} = \frac{1}{3}.eb=z→0lim​z3f(z)​=a3​=3!f′′′(0)​=31​.

For aaa, notice that

−1=f(z)f(−z)=−e−az  ⟹  a=0,-1 = \frac{f\p{z}}{f\p{-z}} = -e^{-az} \implies a = 0,−1=f(−z)f(z)​=−e−az⟹a=0,

and so

sin⁡z−zcos⁡z=z33∏n=1∞(1−z2λn2).\sin{z} - z\cos{z} = \frac{z^3}{3} \prod_{n=1}^\infty \p{1 - \frac{z^2}{\lambda_n^2}}.sinz−zcosz=3z3​n=1∏∞​(1−λn2​z2​).
